stepAnswer: From 10 cellphones to 15 cellphones, the cost averages an increase of 21 per cellphone.
stepTitle: The cost of producing $$x$$ cellphones is described by the function $$C(x)=x^2-4x+1000$$. Find the average rate of change in the total cost as $$x$$ changes from $$x=10$$ to $$x=15$$.
answerLatex: From $$10$$ cellphones to $$15$$ cellphones, the cost averages an increase of $$21$$ per cellphone.
